New Records: Juan Soto hit a game-winning three-run home run in the 10th inning to secure the Yankees' 5-2 victory over the Guardians, advancing them to the World Series
Key Match Events: Juan Soto's go-ahead three-run homer in the 10th inning proved decisive, breaking the deadlock and sending the Yankees to the World Series
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees needed four more wins to claim their 28th World Series title in franchise history
The acquisition of Juan Soto was a significant move by the Yankees
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Manager Aaron Boone highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a sellout, with a stunned crowd no longer interested in waving red towels
The Yankees' celebration was underway, their 41st pennant all but secured
